title: Why Justin Herbert MVP voter picked Chargers QB over Drake Maye, Matthew Stafford
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Justin Herbert received an MVP vote despite less impressive stats and a worse team record compared to Drake Maye.
MVP voter Sam Monson chose Herbert over Maye for navigating challenges including the worst-ranked offensive line, enhancing team value.
Drake Maye had superior statistics, leading in completion percentage and passer rating, but lost the MVP race to Matthew Stafford.

title: Not Your Average Joe’s to close Watertown location after 27 years
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Not Your Average Joe’s in Watertown Square will close on February 11 after 27 years at 55 Main St.
The closure follows the recent shutdown of Not Your Average Joe’s Peabody location in December 2025.
The chain continues operations with locations in Massachusetts and other states including New Hampshire and Virginia.

title: The best movies on Netflix right now (February 2026)
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Netflix offers a curated list of top movies, including classics and new releases like 'Ex Machina' and 'Hell or High Water'.
The list categorizes movies by genre for ease of selection, like drama and comedy, updated with new additions monthly.
Users can contribute suggestions to improve the list or add overlooked favorites via email to Netflix editors.

title: Ayer man accused in racist confrontation hit with new charges tied to boat vandalism
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: David McPartlan is jailed after bail revocation for violating a no-contact order related to a racist confrontation case.
McPartlan allegedly ordered an employee to vandalize Sheron Brown's boat, offering $500 and threatening termination if refused.
McPartlan faces new charges including intimidating a witness and is scheduled for an administrative review session in court.

title: This is the top Super Bowl snack in Massachusetts, according to Coffeeness
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Buffalo chicken dip is the top-searched Super Bowl snack in Massachusetts, according to Coffeeness analysis.
The dip is also the most-searched snack nationwide, topping the list in 31 states.
In Massachusetts, pico de gallo leads searches for healthier Super Bowl snack options.

title: Trump isn’t making a Super Bowl pick, but his press secretary isn’t staying impartial: ‘Go Patriots!’
author: John Waller
bullets: Karoline Leavitt, White House press secretary, expressed support for the Patriots at a press briefing ahead of Super Bowl LX.
President Trump refrained from making a Super Bowl prediction despite recent interactions with Patriots owner Robert Kraft.
Trump will not attend the Super Bowl but will have an interview with NBC's Tom Llamas airing before the game.

title: 6 maps predicting snowfall totals on Saturday
author: John Waller
bullets: An arctic front is expected to bring snowfall to Boston from late Friday night through Saturday.
Eastern Massachusetts might experience localized snow amounts of 4-6 inches, with widespread snowfall expected to be 2-4 inches.
The coast may see snow accumulation between 3-6 inches, affected by potential ocean enhancement.

title: Think you know the Patriots’ Super Bowl history? Take the quiz.
author: Kelly Chan and Hayden Bird
bullets: The New England Patriots will face the Seattle Seahawks in the 2026 Super Bowl this Sunday.
The Patriots famously won Super Bowl LI in 2017, coming back from a 28-3 deficit to win 34-28 in overtime.
A quiz challenges fans on their knowledge of the Patriots' Super Bowl history, including memorable games and achievements.

title: Patriots star Christian Gonzalez has a big fan in Bruins legend Zdeno Chara
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots' Christian Gonzalez honors Boston sports icons with custom pregame shirts, featuring legends like Zdeno Chara and Bill Russell.
Gonzalez's tribute to Bruins legend Chara came as his No. 33 jersey was retired, earning praise from Chara himself.
Gonzalez excelled in postseason coverage, facing 28 targets and allowing only 11 receptions, drawing comparisons to Chara's defensive prowess.

title: Inside the origin of the Patriots’ ‘road warriors’ rallying cry
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots are undefeated on the road this season, boasting a 9-0 record.
The 'Road Warriors' mantra was inspired by wrestling clips and the 1979 film 'The Warriors,' motivating the team.
Coach Mike Vrabel led the Patriots to embrace a road-game identity, choosing white uniforms for Super Bowl LX.
